messages.text: Should I change gyp to include BrowserFrameViewChromeos files for aura build to get rid of "#if defined(OS_CHROMEOS)"?

On 2012/01/07 00:51:39, xiyuan wrote:
> Should I change gyp to include BrowserFrameViewChromeos files for aura build to
> get rid of "#if defined(OS_CHROMEOS)"?

I think we're trying to keep win_aura and linux_chromeos_aura behaving similarly as much as possible.  What about renaming browser_frame_view_chromeos.h/cc to compact_browser_frame_view.h/cc, moving it into chrome/browser/ui/views/frame, and using it for ChromeOS Aura, ChromeOS non-Aura, and Win Aura?  Does that look like a lot of work?

On 2012/01/07 04:42:02, James Cook (Chromium) wrote:
> On 2012/01/07 00:51:39, xiyuan wrote:
> > Should I change gyp to include BrowserFrameViewChromeos files for aura build
> to
> > get rid of "#if defined(OS_CHROMEOS)"?
> 
> I think we're trying to keep win_aura and linux_chromeos_aura behaving similarly
> as much as possible.  What about renaming browser_frame_view_chromeos.h/cc to
> compact_browser_frame_view.h/cc, moving it into chrome/browser/ui/views/frame,
> and using it for ChromeOS Aura, ChromeOS non-Aura, and Win Aura?  Does that look
> like a lot of work?

Oh, and I like the idea of just reusing the existing chromeos implementation code.  Good idea!

On 2012/01/07 04:42:02, James Cook (Chromium) wrote:
> On 2012/01/07 00:51:39, xiyuan wrote:
> > Should I change gyp to include BrowserFrameViewChromeos files for aura build
> to
> > get rid of "#if defined(OS_CHROMEOS)"?
> 
> I think we're trying to keep win_aura and linux_chromeos_aura behaving similarly
> as much as possible.  What about renaming browser_frame_view_chromeos.h/cc to
> compact_browser_frame_view.h/cc, moving it into chrome/browser/ui/views/frame,
> and using it for ChromeOS Aura, ChromeOS non-Aura, and Win Aura?  Does that look
> like a lot of work?

That's exactly I want to find out. And compact_browser_frame_view sounds like a good name to me.

OK.  I don't care much about the #ifdef OS_CHROME (it's nice to eliminate, but it doesn't really bother me).  I just don't like the idea of win_aura having to include files from chromeos/ directories, which is why I suggested the rename.  Code search only shows three or four places it is used, so I don't think the change will be too bad.

Done with BrowserFrameViewChromeos -> CompactBrowserFrameView renaming.

Pleast take a look. Thanks.
sky/ben, could any of you bless this CL? Thanks.

CQ is trying da patch. Follow status at
https://chromium-status.appspot.com/cq/xiyuan@chromium.org/9127015/5001

subject: Use CompactBrowserFrameView for Aura compact mode.
